avalancheActivity.comment:
The weather will be very warm. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation wet and gliding avalanches are possible from the late morning. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on very steep slopes. Occasionally large natural avalanches are possible especially on rocky sunny slopes.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released in some cases at intermediate and high altitudes. The dry avalanches can as before reach medium size.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be concluded before midday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase quickly in particular on very steep sunny slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack is frozen, but not to a significant depth and will already soften in the late morning. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.

At intermediate and high altitudes there is more snow than usual.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will decrease.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The weather will be very warm. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are to be expected from the late morning. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible in particular on steep sunny slopes. Low altitudes: On very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in the last few days in high Alpine regions. Wind slabs can be released and reach medium size.

Off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. The avalanche danger will already increase in the late morning.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The surface of the snowpack is frozen, but not to a significant depth and will soften during the day. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.
The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

At intermediate and high altitudes a very large amount of snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will decrease.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The weather will be very warm. Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day. Avalanches are possible in the late morning, but they can be large in isolated cases. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released and generally at elevated altitudes. Dry slab avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be concluded before midday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather conditions will bring about a rise in the avalanche danger in the late morning.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack is frozen, but not to a significant depth and will soften quickly. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will decrease.
